title: 39 Ways to Save the Planet: #10 Phenomenal Photosynthesis

cards.definition: The process used by plants and other organisms to convert light energy into chemical energy. From the reactants, including carbon dioxide and water, carbohydrates such as sugars are synthesised.

multiplechoice.text: Plants typically capture about __% of energy from the sun.
If Glaia's research leads to a 20% increase in plant photosynthesis what effect could this have on GHG emissions?
multiplechoice.answer: A reduction of up to 8% of emissions
answers: A reduction of no less than 10% of emissions
A reduction of up to 18% of emissions
A increase of no more than 2% of emissions

multiplechoice.text: Glaia's carbon-based material enables plants to __?
multiplechoice.answer: Restart photosynthesis more quickly after exposure to strong sunlight
answers: Absorb more energy from the sun

unranked.text: What is the name of the molecule that absorbs the sun's energy?
